facts.title: Improved Circulation
facts.description: After 20 minutes of quitting smoking, your circulation improves. Blood pressure and heart rate decrease, reducing the risk of a heart attack.

facts.title: Nicotine Levels Drop
facts.description: After 8 hours, nicotine and carbon monoxide levels in your blood decrease, and oxygen levels rise.

facts.title: Health Benefits Over Time
facts.description: After 1 day, carbon monoxide is eliminated; after 2-3 days, sense of taste and smell improve; after 2-12 weeks, circulation improves and lung function increases.

facts.title: Reduced Risk of Diseases
facts.description: After 1 year, the risk of coronary heart disease is half that of a smoker's; after 10 years, the risk of lung cancer is half that of a smoker's.

facts.title: Improved Fertility
facts.description: For those trying to conceive, quitting smoking can improve fertility and increase the chances of a healthy pregnancy.

facts.title: Youthful Skin
facts.description: Quitting smoking can lead to improved skin health, reducing premature aging and wrinkles.

facts.title: Better Dental Health
facts.description: Quitting smoking lowers the risk of gum disease and tooth loss, leading to better oral health.

facts.title: Improved Mood
facts.description: As the body adjusts to life without nicotine, many people experience improved mood and reduced stress.

facts.title: Financial Savings
facts.description: Quitting smoking saves money in the long run, as cigarettes can be a significant ongoing expense.

facts.title: Improved Lung Function
facts.description: Over time, lung function improves, making activities like climbing stairs and exercising easier.

facts.title: Lowered Risk of Stroke
facts.description: Quitting smoking lowers the risk of stroke, contributing to overall cardiovascular health.

facts.title: Improved Immune System
facts.description: A smoke-free lifestyle supports a stronger immune system, helping the body fight off infections.

facts.title: Reduced Respiratory Infections
facts.description: Quitting smoking reduces the risk of respiratory infections, such as colds and flu.

facts.title: Better Sleep
facts.description: Many people experience improved sleep quality after quitting smoking, leading to better overall well-being.

facts.title: Improved Taste and Smell
facts.description: Quitting smoking enhances the senses of taste and smell, making food more enjoyable.

facts.title: Lowered Risk of Diabetes
facts.description: Non-smokers generally have a lower risk of developing type 2 diabetes compared to smokers.

facts.title: Healthier Heart and Blood Vessels
facts.description: Quitting smoking contributes to a healthier heart and blood vessels, supporting overall cardiovascular health.

facts.title: Improved Concentration
facts.description: Many ex-smokers report better concentration and cognitive function after quitting.

facts.title: Increased Life Expectancy
facts.description: Quitting smoking is associated with an increased life expectancy and a longer, healthier life.

facts.title: Positive Impact on Others
facts.description: Quitting smoking not only benefits your health but also has a positive impact on those around you, reducing secondhand smoke exposure.
